Reviews.Title: “Kissimmee Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mc_Grafity
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay, staff are very good, rooms are clean, and comes with everything you need. Dishes, appliances etc: The grounds and pool are very nice and clean as well.Beds are very comfortable, has around the clock security very close to all shopping and attractions, would come back for sure. No restaurant on site. But Groceries in Forida are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: JerseyAJ
Reviews.Content: Like many visitors, after reading the comments that the place is dated, i was thinking it would be worn and in need of refurbishing. From the condition of the unit we were in, i think it's the style that makes the place look dated - peach and sea foam green painted walls (appeared freshly painted too), rattan furniture, tropical print cushions and curtains, dining table with glass table top. Everything was clean and for the most part in good working order (issue with light in master bedroom). The grounds and the pools are clean too. There are many activities on the grounds to enjoy like basketball, tennis, volley ball, putting green, shuffle board. There's also a game room. We had an end unit in the Saturn building on the 3rd floor. There are no elevators. This wasn't an issue for us but could be for some folks. However, what was an issue is the vaulted ceilings in the master bedroom with the 6 windows on the high part of the wall. There are no blinds or curtains. It wasn't a problem for me, but for my husband, it was an issue. He was up at sunrise every morning. If you are headed to the Disney's Animal Kingdom - do not make right onto Route 192. Instead, at the light, go straight and that road takes you there without the 192 traffic mess. Of course, check out mapquest before you do just in case I don't recall a turn or two. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: alexandra1721
Reviews.Content: I spent a week long late summer vacation at Orbit One and I felt as though I had found a hidden gem. The resort doesn't sit directly on the main street, so it may not attract the most street traffic, but it definitely makes for a quiet stay without any street noise! That being said, I stayed at a time when landscaping and construction werebeing done around the parking areas, and unfortunately, much of the work was being done at night! This meant that two of the five nights spent at Orbit One were very noisy which didn't allow for very much sleep. When this was brought to the attention of guest services, it wasn't met with very much empathy or understanding, which left a bit of a damper on my stay. However, for one of the more popular places to stay in the area, the value was fantastic and we were very close to several restaurants, shops, and all the major theme parks. The beds were all very comfortable and I loved the fact that our villa had so many windows to let in tons of natural sunlight. It made for a very bright, comfortable atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Surprise In Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: NyCahk
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at Orbit One Villas in February 2012. I booked it based upon other reviews, but still had doubts as it is an older resort. When we got there, my husband walked in the front door, came back out and said, "you are going to be very happy." He was very right. Orbit may be an older resort, but it is completely up to date. Our two bedroom villa had lots of room and was very clean. There was a jacuzzi tub in the master bathroom, a patio, even a little sunroom. The best feature for me was the washer/dryer combo. The pool has small waterslides. There are tennis courts, indoor handball court and a game room. Breakfast is light; coffee, juice and danish. They will try to get you to attend a sales presentation, but you don't have to. I realize I am gushing a bit. I have been to Kissimmee many times, and this may have been my best hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: RAylward
Reviews.Content: LOVED IT! The place was better than expected! Close to everything, free parking, nice pool, very clean rooms, kitchen comes with all the basic essentials! For the price, it was an amazing value. Would definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Craftylori
Reviews.Content: This place has lots of space, kitchen facilities and bathrooms. You can save money by doing some cooking or eating breakfast at the hotel. It is close to Disney and the attractions in Orlando. Very spacious and can easily be shared by two small families to save money. If you travel during the "low" season you can get a great deal on this place on Expedia. It is less than the price of a small hotel room in Toronto! You have laundry facilities in each condo so take some laundry soap as well as extra soap for the dishwater as they only supply a small amount.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Vickie M
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first vacaion in 6 years and we are so glad we chose Orbit One. We stayed for a week. The rooms were very large, the kitchen was well equipped with everything we needed. We would have loved to bring another family with us. Everything was clean and maintained very well. There were 2 pools, one for the kids and one for the adults which were nicely heated (since the weather wasn't great). There were always clean towels at the pool and the staff was always a great help. The only dissapointment was that the WIFI wasn't free (but Starbucks was only 5 minutes away). We will definitely stay here again. Great place for the money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Christy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and loved it! I was able to cook great dinners, the room itself had everything needed to cook with. The size itself was awesome, there was 2 adults and 3 kids. The master bedroom had a tub that was huge and very relaxing. Disney parks were like 5 minutes away. My only regret was the stay was not long enough. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top place to stay for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: chipss
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay. Beautiful inside, so spacious, 2 bathroom, masses of space, washing machine and tunmbkle dryer, property equipt with everything you need, do not have to bring towels not even for the pool they are all claen supplied free daily. Pools are lovely and reletively quiet as loads of people are off out during the days. The pool stays open to 11pm. The security come and get you out when there are lightning storms which is good. You can park right outside your room. Internet on site although if you pay for a week or 2 other people can then log on for free once you have paid, it seems to open it up to all once someone has paid, had to get a full refund once I realised this. Staff are nice and will charge up your camera at the reception if you ask them to via their PC. Great TV. Any fault and the caretakers are there in minutes. Pefect location about a 10-15 min drive from Disney. Dennys round the corner walking distance, you will probably go there lots of times, we did as convienient and cheap and great staff. Do visit the flea markets for bargains and also the Sizzler restuartant lovely buffett food. Road signs hard to follow and time wasting, I wish I had of paid the extra £50 for a Sat Nav now, you will defo need it. Weather great, bad thunder and lighning storms though, free breaksaft and coffees etc in the lounge in the morning, worth going to. TV is great, loads of channels with great pictures. You can get extra room keys at reception. Careful crossing the 10 lane roads though on foot as traffic lights dont last long in pedestrians favour. I would drive everywhere, even round the corner if you have to cross a main road. I would 100% recommend this resort, perfect, perfect,

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing, economical”
Reviews.Author: askmey
Reviews.Content: This facility is an economical vacation villa. Good size villa with all you need to set up housekeeping for a week or two. Although it looked like most of the villas were in use, the facillity was surprisingly quiet. Pools were warm. We used the gas grills one night for some home grilled steak. We found the staff friendly and helpful. Coffee and donuts in the morning were good--as non-breakfast eaters they were a nice morning snack. Quick access to Disney and I-4.

Reviews.Title: “Our Orlando Home”
Reviews.Author: vlegore
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical of the quality of this resort for the low price, though other reviews were encouraging. My concerns were for naught after the first night here. Though the property is older, it is immaculate and well maintained. The unit was HUGE and well equipped. The staff was great not only for answering questions but for sincere personal service - even took care of printing my return trip boarding passes while I was off at a park all day. I will surely stay here anytime I come to Orlando My only criticism is the disappointing continental breakfast and limited vending options, but there are plenty of stores nearby to get what we need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place (just older)”
Reviews.Author: gonecode6
Reviews.Content: I have to say the reviews are honest and the entire resort is well kept and clean. The rooms a 2 bedrooms and all face the pool and are walk through from the parking area right to the pool side ,so everyone has a view. The rooms are clean and have full kitchens and 2 baths....One has a HUGE Jetted tub (about 5 ft square) but it didn't work.....Like I said the resort is older but they try hard. The front desk staff are great and you can borrow rackets for tennis or many other sports on site.Nancy was wonderful and very helpful to everyone. The units are 3 stories and NO ELEVATOR so older people be advised...Climbing stairs is required, with your luggage. The pools ( they have 2) are warm and the main pool has two slides great for kids....There is also a HOT-TUB for parents, The area is close to 192 and you hear traffic and sirens at times....Close to everything though. Our one complaint...... Is what happens in most older condo's ( built early 80's) WALLS ARE PAPER THIN ! I mean you hear everything ! From TV's next door to if you unlucky enough to be under someone who moves furniture at night....We had someone move in our last night above us and OH MY ! They were unreal. It sounded like thunder for several hours until they got tired and went to bed at 1 am..... On Site Security 24 hours also but we never called...If we had to stay longer we sure would have. Some people only think about themselves and car little about others. We checked out the next day and honestly , if we had to stay longer ....It would have been very unpleasant because every time they move a chair it sounds like thunder below. Be advised the walls are THIN , THIN ! We could hear the TV next door clear enough to know what they were watching Granted we paid less than $300.00 a week so hard to complain....BUT WOW , LOUD! Noisiest place we have ever stayed without having an adjoining room .....EVER !

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: AnonHerts
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay and although we looked at other hotels both on and off Disney property we're drawn back by the quality and value offered by Orbit One. We always choose self catering as we like to be our own boss on holiday.  Orbit One is ideal as the condo's are well equipped and spacious with everything we need.   The pool, hot tub and in room tub are exactly what is needed after a long day in the parks and the staff are always helpful. Location is perfect for Disney.   Close enough to be able to pop back for. Breaking the afternoon before heading out for the fireworks. Wish we were still there!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - great time once again!”
Reviews.Author: TwirlingTina
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit after spending about four years previous on Disney property for a week in late January each year. Nothing against staying on Disney property; great when my son was little but this location is great for all of the theme parks and attractions! Clean and affordable if you are not going during the Springbreak...always quiet and great deal end of January/beginning of February! Son loves having a room and bathroom all to himself and we even brought along his friend this year as the room has two single beds...lots of room, clean, safe, helpful staff...housecleaning provided midway thru the week on Wednesdays! Parks, shopping and restaurants all very close by! Will do again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: BramptonFamily
Reviews.Content: Just spent 8 nights at this resort, and was pleasantly surprised. The condo was big and was fully stocked, everything from sponges,laundry soap, dish soap,lots of towels and a new batch was dropped off mid week. We felt very safe and we could walk out to the strip for breakfast or coffee at Dunkin Donuts(not tim's but will do). The coffee offered down in the lobby was actually better. We stayed in the Saturn building and it was great, we could hear no traffic but was still close to everything. The third floor is worth the trip up the stairs cause of the high ceilings and no one will be above you. We had a few minor problems, the jets on the tub didn't work, the floors (tile) were very very dirty (son's white socks were black and so were my slippers). I had to make a reservation by phone and was charged for long distance for a 3 minute call ended up costing me $7.50, so beware. You will be charged even if your call dosen't connect, I think it something like .87cents per call. Very disappointed about the no wifi, considering a cheaper hotel across the street offers this they need to address this issue, I was told by the front staff that any internet was to be paid for. All in all they have painted the outside recently and it dosen't looked dated and the grounds are very well kept. We played tennis everyday, the courts are great and no one was there. The pool was heated and was very clean, my son loved the water slides, I wouldn't recommend this place for young kids cause the pool starts at 3 and a half feet so unless they can swim they might not have alot of fun. For the price this is a great place to take the family, great location, close to the parks and everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Each Bldg Named after Planets”
Reviews.Author: RAD00
Reviews.Content: Went there a few weeks ago and stayed in the Mercury building. It was planned with Armed Forces Vacation Club. Paid about $400 for the week. I also went to a time share at their sister resort and got $75 for it. I originally stayed on the third floor. Big mistake. They have a sky window about 10 feet up. No curtain on it. The moon and outdoor lights shine right through it. Next day I was transferred to the 2nd floor in the same bldg. Much better. Going up and down the stairs was no problem. Cleaning up after yourself was no problem either. Good security safe in master room. One tv was flatscreen and the other was not. Big difference in watching them. Basic cable with one HBO channel. Walls in bedroom are not real thick. Was able to hear voices in other rooms. You do get charged for local and 1-800 calls. Not real thrilled about that. They had free internet in the main building. You could view but had to have a special code to print. No printer by the computer. Had to go to main desk to print out boarding passes. They have security guard at the front gate. It is not 24 hour though. There were times when he is not present. There is a Publix and Super Target store about two miles from the villas. This is an older villa. The furniture and carpets could probably be replaced. The grounds are well-maintained. There are pools, basketball, shuffleboard, putting course and indoor racquetball. If I came back to Orlando this would definitly be a place to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay !”
Reviews.Author: georgie6767
Reviews.Content: We originally booked to stay here 6 nights but were so happy I cancelled my reservation at the loews to stay another 5 nights. We arrived at midnight & was checked in by Mike the security guard (very helpful & welcoming). I had asked for a top floor unit which we were given and was really impressed with the space and decoration. The master bedroom was lovely with a huge ensuite which looked new and a beautiful big square spa jet bath. Our 2 teenagers shared the other bedroom and were very happy to have their own tv and bathroom although it certainly wasnt as luxurious as ours! The master bed opened onto the balcony which was screened and very private. We absolutely loved the space and convenience to the disney parks and i4. We cooked a few times and found everything we needed. One of the best things about the resort is the 2 swimming pools and hot tub which are open until 11pm and beautifully warm. I can honestly say that we had a wonderful relaxing time and would have to wonder why bother with a hotel room when you can have all that space for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “great family place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hopPortlandMi
Reviews.Content: The staff here was nothing but wonderful we booked this through an resort certficate that we got through my husbands work. We had 2 condos and 2 families traveling together the staff made sure we were put together on the main floor with a pool right outside our condo. The kids pool was only a short walk away. Disney is very close and if you program animal kingdom into gps it will take you a shorter back way in. The outside of the units are older but the inside is great and has everything you need and if you forget something the front staff will give you one for a small fee. We had a great time here and would highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by its cover. Nice rooms, excellent value in great location.”
Reviews.Author: ERFSU82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom villa. Using credit card reward points, we paid only $10/night. When we booked it, I was concerned about what kind of place it woul be since the deal seemed to good to be true. When we arrived, the entrance and overall look of the place caused us some reservation, but we were pleasantly surprised when we saw our villa. It was roomy, clean, and well-furnished. Plenty of room for our family of 5 - all 3 kids had their own beds. Screened-in balcony was great for sitting and reading. Pool area was very nice and well-maintained, with a hot tub, large pool, 2 slides and a splash fountain. Although it's in a congested tourist-trap area, that's hard to avoid that in the Orlando area. It's 2 miles off of I-4 and less than 10 minutes from the Disney parks and attractions. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic vacation condos close to disney!”
Reviews.Author: marialovesmexico
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 11 night stay at orbit one and it was our first time ever staying in condo's and I'm SO glad we did! Let me first say that the night I got there I fell terribly sick, sinus infection, strep throat,fever, horrible cough which flared up my asthma, etc the whole works.. I was MISERABLE! staying in a condo was so much better because it felt like I was "home" there is nothing worse then being sick away from home.. that wasn't the case here because it's set up like an apartment I felt very comfortable there, and the first 5 days of my 11 day stay was spent totally sick in bed and I didn't even leave the condo once..So I really grew to call that place home. I loved that there was the full kitchen there My hubby was able to go to the grocery store and we stalked up on orange juice, tea, and soup since that was I all could pretty much eat :( but regardless of being miserable like i said if I had to be sick on vacation I'm glad it was here. if we had stayed in a regular hotel I'd have been forced to get dressed and go out to eat feeling miserable.. the HUGE AWESOME JETTED tub also came in super handy!!! with my cough and wheezing and stuff I'd hop in that tub and make it nice and steamy and it would clear me right up!! I pretty much lived in that tub and and in bed- well finally I felt human again on the 5th day and was able to explore the grounds a bit! we went and took a dip in the pool which is heated and was SO nice! they had a volley ball net, and another pool with a two little slides , lots of amenities! they also had some basic Continental breakfast stuff during the week day which we only ate from once it was just donuts, mini muffins. coffee and juice. but it was still nice! The condos themselves all come equipped with a washer and dryer which was really nice so we knew that before hand and were able to pack lighter since we knew we could wash that came in super handy too! I'll forewarn you it does take a while for the clothes to wash and dry but it does the job. also the washer spins reallllllly slow I was wondering if it could even possibly get clean going that slow but it did! here is what they had for toiletries so you know what to bring 2 bars of hand or body soap, two little tiny packets of tooth paste, if you are staying more than one night you'll need extra tooth paste, trash bags (we had enough for our whole stay), dish soap, dishwasher packet, we did run out of that so you may need to be prepared to buy extra dishwasher detergent if you have those tablets at home I'd maybe bring a few their small and then you wont have to buy any while there, it came with one box of laundry detergent, we ended up doing three loads while there but luckily I did bring two single packets of laundry detergent from home so I didn't have to buy extra while there. and that was it. so you'll need to bring your own shampoo, lotions, conditioner, body wash, etc because those things are not provided. and be prepared to possibly need more dishwasher tablets and more laundry detergent if you'll be running the dishwasher and washer and dryer often- In the kitchen everything was there that I could have possibly needed , baking sheets, pots, pans, plenty of dishes, etc, there is a toaster, microwave, coffee pot, tea kettle, and a full size fridge. the freezer is a bit small but it was sufficient. bed was pretty comfy, I love the enclosed patio that comes with all the rooms it was nice because you were outside but the screen prevented any bugs from getting in and there was a fan out on the patio too! there isn't much to complain about but there were a few minor things that would have made this place an A+ rather than just an A 1.)they charged a ridiculous amount for internet we have smart phones so we got by with just using that 2.)the living room furniture is more like patio furniture so it's not to comfy- the better TV is in the living room but we chose to watch TV in the bedroom most of the time when we did because the bed was more comfy 3.) I do with they would supply more toiletries and a little more dishwasher detergent and laundry soap with no additional costs- next time I'll just bring these things from home though so it wont be an issue 4.)I wish they had some sort of an elevator even though it's only 3 floors. it did get tiresome dragging the luggage and groceries up those stairs next time I'll request ground floor and that wont be an issue 5.) you had to pay for house keeping services- they do exchange your towels for you and bring new ones but no vacuuming, sweeping, or making of the beds unless you want to pay that would be it for any sort of complaints and thats not enough to keep me away I really liked this place a lot and would definitely stay again! like I said it felt like a home away from home! the location was great every other time we have stayed in Orlando we stayed over off of I drive by sea world.. But this area was nice because it had a TON of resteraunts all right there to choose from, there was sizzler, bob evans, perkins, i hop, mcdonalds, and just so many the list is endless on that main street. We found two FANTASTIC resteraunts we fell in love with down the street one was bahama breeze and the other was houlihans great food at both places. there was lots of discount gift stores right there too with in walking distance. Word of advice to folks there are a lot of "fake people" trying to buy and sell used Disney tickets DO NOT buy from them! they are fake! everything in Disney is based off finger prints.. those tickets are NOT legit! there is a person who sells tickets in the lobby here and I even wondered about them... I didn't buy any but the prices didn't seem right. So we just stuck with buying our tickets directly from Disney. You can however get a discount on tickets if your military or AAA we learned this after it was too late you can also get free parking with AAA- the discount wasn't a ton I think it was only a few $'s savings but next time I will go with them since savings is savings :) We only got one phone call about doing a time share tour they weren't pushy and we declined because we had plans the next morning they were polite and said ok and that was that- if we had had the time we probably would have done the tour though just for the incentive and for the fact we'd like to come back here again- Well that All I can think of! Enjoy your stay you'll love it! it will be your home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Lllongisland
Reviews.Content: Spacious villa. Quiet grounds. I would recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Disney World Stay”
Reviews.Author: SBtravelller
Reviews.Content: Hello, First this was a family stay this past summer from the end of June tthrough the 4th of July 2011 for 2 adults with two pre-teen boys. Check in is easy and wonderfull. We arrived VERY early and they made great efforts to get us checked in early. Honestly we showed up around 10am with a 3pm check in. They got us checked in within an hour.....which was not only EXCELLENT, but gave us a little time to check out the area and find grocery stores and restuarants. Also they listened to our request to be near the pool for the kids and we were directly next to it. Durning the day we spent most of our time at Disney, but it was really nice to come home from the hot long days to our air-conditioned villa. And it is not very far from all the attractions. Once you learn the Florida Hwy's (which are pretty confusing), you can get to Disney in about 10 min. Ok, now for the rooms. Everything was as described. The master had a big comfortable bed (no cheap mattresses here), but I can't remember if it was a queen or king....king I think. The other room had two twin beds. The best part is that the rooms are seperated by two bathrooms....giving parents a little space and privacy. Also there is a washer/dryer unit in the villa. The units come fully furnished, dishes, silverware, dishwasher, tv's in both rooms and the living room. The patio area is also screened in to prevent mosqitos & other insects, of which there are too many! The resort although small still had plenty of amenities, they have a small game room, basketball courts, a good size pool with 2 slides, and more. Everyone was friendly and happy to help. I highly recommend this place as a great alternative to HUGE resorts where no one will know or remember your name. But keep in mind it is not a 5 star resort.....and you will be more than happy with what you get for the money here. If I go back to Disney, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “nice property”
Reviews.Author: ualcid
Reviews.Content: very comfortable and large unit. This is a smaller resort with about 150 units. There are two pools, tennis courts and basketball court. Staff is friendly and the grounds are kept well. It is just off hwy 192 at mile marker 4 and within walking distance of many shops and resturants.We stayed for two weeks and enjoyed the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Julianne C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the week of Thanksgiving. Nice, big and comfy. Loved the amnenites as well, pool and all the sports that were available to play. Definitely will stay here again next Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: chdopaka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the end of October the unit was large and close to 192. We stayed in the back unit this area was very quiet, staff was very pleasant and helpful. Units are older but clean and comfortable would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY spacious and clean apartment”
Reviews.Author: travelbug56Miami
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 day with a couple of friends when visiting Orlando Parks. I was impressed by the space and cleanliness of the place. The kitchen is very nice with everything you need. Very big living room. Nice bedrooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “great condo”
Reviews.Author: weloveamerica
Reviews.Content: only stayed for 2 nights due to delayed flight. The condo is huge and so is the master bathrooms tub. The grounds are really nice and so are both pools, which provide seperate pool towels at the poolside so you dont have to take the condo's. very safe as securite on site on the driveway in. There is a full kitchen and washer and dryer. Its a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Lexcat70
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) stayed at Orbit One between October 16 and October 30 2011. We rented the two bedroom condo, room Saturn 11. The condo was VERY spacious, VERY clean and everything you can possibly need is there. The children had their own bathroom and we got ours with a HUGE jacuzzi. We had a large King size bed in the master bedroom, two twin beds in the second bedroom and a sofa-bed in the living room. The condo was also equipped with 3 televisions, DVD and CD Player, in room safe, hair dryer, fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, blender, washer & dryer and a screened porch. We were on the second floor with a nice view on the kids playground and BBQ area. The hotel is on a very quiet street close to the 192 with all restaurants and stores you can imagine nearby (Sizzler, Golden Corral, Denny's, Ponderosa, IHOP, Cracker Barrel), Shell, Walgreen, Target and Publix nearby. It is also 10 minutes drive to Disney Maingate, 3 minutes to Animal Kingdom and about 15 minutes drive to Sea World and Universal Parks. The whole family especially the kids LOVED the pool with 2 water slides and the playground. If needed, you can buy Wi-Fi internet access for $30/ week You can also buy a family pass ($5 for a family up to 6 peoples) to go to Liki Tiki Village Resort (another Island One resort nearby) and take advantage of all activities they offer (Great waterpark with 5 water slides, mini-golf, bicycle. paddle boats, kids playground ...We booked with Expedia and got the room for $1026 CAD for 14 nights. What a deal! Can't wait to go back, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort close to restaurants and Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: S_Florida05
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) have stayed here multiple times over the last 5 years, renting a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo. The rooms have full kitchens and full size washer/dryers. You can find excellent deals even if you are only staying a few nights. The condos are spacious and conveniently located close to several restaurants and within 2 miles of an entrance to Disneyworld. There is also a Publix grocery store a few minutes away. It is just off of Hwy 192 but still very quiet. The only negative is they charge for internet access in the rooms, however, wireless internet is free in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location near Disney”
Reviews.Author: Sugarloafers
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare resort, but since timeshares have virtually no value now, most of these 2/2 condos are rented out by their owners. For $400-500/week you can get a 2 bedroom/2 bath condo with a full kitchen and washer/dryer. The complex has tennis courts, racketball courts, 2 pools, a small putting green and a game room. Each condo has a nice screened porch. They are spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hessitate to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: penlanspice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in a 2 bed apartment (family also had the 2 bed apartment next door) the place was extremely clean and couldn't really find fault with it, they were spacious and had all the necessary amenities. The pools weren't huge but big enough and were always quite, internet was a little pricey but if you have wireless you could pick it up in the lobby or just outside for free. The staff were great and pretty helpful. Orbit one isn't a big resort but had everything you need in a great location for Disney.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: paula112233
Reviews.Content: Orbit One provided my family with a perfect vacation stay. The 2 bdr/2baths, full size kitchen gave us plenty of room. The place inside and out was very clean. Pool was great and not very crowded. My family enjoyed playing tennis, basketball, and volleyball. Location was great, being closest to Disney, Universal and Seaworld less than 20 min. away. I felt safe there and in the surrounding area. I also think that Orbit put the extra touch on our stay by providing and restocking the paper towels, toilet paper, laundry soap, dishwasing soap, etc. and fresh towels were exchange with an easy phone call. I have stayed in beach front houses before where we had to suppy all of that. All this and at a great rate that is cheaper than staying at a cramped hotel. Thanks Orbit for helping us have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Love it- Peaceful and Clean”
Reviews.Author: clj64
Reviews.Content: Located right on 192 which is minutes from all Disney Parks. The grounds are really nice, upkeep great. 2 pools, Gas grills, BB, Volleyball, Tennis, Raquet Ball, Game Room, Coffee and Donuts in Lobby. Apartment is spacious. Everything is really clean and well kept. Beds are comfy. Patios are enclosed and real nice. Lots of light from the outdoors and they have sky lights and its so cool. Bathrooms are up to date and really cute. Overall rooms are really nice especially for the money you pay. One day my son broke the shower rod and I called and they were here in less than 5min to fix it. We needed batteries for a toy we purchased from the flea market and they provided the batteries to our room in less than 5 min no cost. I can't even believe the hospitality here. We loved our stay and the rooms, pools and how quiet it is. FYI- DO not purchase your tickets from the vendors on the streets we watched them being arrested for selling tickets with no days. When they purchase them from the vacationers they have no idea how many days are on them to sell. We purchased our tickets from Disney Parks and sold them to local vendors for the days that we didn't use. It is worth it to purchase extra b/c you will get it back from the locals. Also we purchased the kids eat free card. It works and is nice to have if you visit the resturaunts listed. We got our money out of it but some may not. Do not think that hanging during the day to stay cool and visits the parks at night works as it is worse at night. Everyone has that very same idea.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at orbit”
Reviews.Author: nadus30
Reviews.Content: I stay here with my husband and my 4yrs old son and 19 months daughter from 5/15-5/20. On the outside it make you question your choice of staying here, like my husband said what did u bring after we just check out of the embassy suite.But everything was perfect the room was big and clean, i did bring my own sheets but didn't have to use them.The bathroom was newly done and there seems like work is still going on. we went to their sister resort LiKi Tiki for $6 for the day to use the pool and water park which was very nice but the food was expensive. They also offer a timeshare tour for $50 but i didn't think it was worth my time, can't said if the called because my 19 months old alway had the phone off the hook. At one point i tried the make coffee the the coffee was filthy, i guess the last guest didn't know how to use it and left it and mess and the front desk jasmin and housekeeping response in less than 10 min to replace it with a new coffee maker. It was a very nice stay and the only thing i can complain about was the fact the they really doesn't have a pool for the kids, pool was 3ft-6ft and that is the only reason i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value, spacious, clean, close to everything yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: tissuesandteatree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orbit One for a week and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. + Apartment was very big and spacious + Kitchen was fully equipped and lots of little extras + Huge, comfortable bed in master bedroom with crisp, clean linen + Generous sized second bedroom with plenty of wardrobe space + Safe, well maintained pool area + Accommodating to our late arrival (security guard was polite and efficient) + Easy walk or very short car journey to loads of restaurants and shops + Set back off the main road so very quiet + 20 or so minutes to all major attractions This place is good enough to use as a base for visiting the attractions and as a great place to hang out by the pool too. There's no entertainment which is no loss to us but if that's something you're after, perhaps consider elsewhere. Overall, an excellent, well maintained property ideally suited for people who want to have a do-it-yourself holiday. One negative: you have to pay for internet access. Quick tip: don’t use the ‘supermarkets’ near the hotel. Go a few miles West to Super Target or Publix for a much better selection at un-inflated tourist prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tracey084
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Orbit One was back in 2004. I remembered it being outdated, under repair but otherwise ok. Needless to say, I wasn't exactly excited this trip when it got right down to the wire and Orbit One was the best option for the price. I think I even covered my eyes when I was clicking on "confirm reservation" lol It did have the four things we were looking for though #1) Close to Disney #2) Full Kitchen #3) Washer/ Dryer #4) at least 2 bedrooms. I had looked on trip advisor and saw that the newer pics and reviews were better than they were in 2004 too. We stayed during spring break with our three children ages 6,9 and 11. When we arrived check-in was quick and easy. The staff was super nice/helpful, the rooms were very clean...and had been updated since our last trip. Staff/Service: We did have a problem with our room key when we first got there. Our room was located just across from the office, so my husband went to let them know while the girls and I waited at the room door. The maintainence staff actually got to our room and fixed the problem within seconds..my husband had not even made it all the way back to the room before it was fixed. About half way through the trip we needed extra towels. We were returning to our room around 8 or 9 in the evening. I never imagined we would get towels that night, but called to let them know we needed some the next day. Again, within 5 minutes someone was at our room with a bag of towels, wash clothes, etc. So, as far as the staff/service goes I have to give them an A+. The Room: I posted pics. You can see for yourself how nice the rooms are. Everything was clean...even the floors, baseboards, etc. The kitchen was well stocked. *the best* thing about the room (and the reason we decided to go ahead and book this time) was the HUGE masterbedroom tub. After a day at the parks it is just wonderful. The pics really do not do the size justice. The beds were comfortable. The Pool: The main pool has 2 slides and is heated. The girls had fun playing at the pool. During our stay, it seemed to be mainly retired people there. Which for the kids meant no waiting in line at the slides and a giant pool to themselves mostly. On Thursday afternoon they had an "ice-cream social" ..... which was the fancy way of saying "free ice-cream sitting on the table if you want it" .... but ice-cream is ice-cream and the kids loved it. The hot tub was under repairs the entire week, but I will get to that in a sec. *** If you do have children, I highly recommend getting the pass from the office to go to the pool at Liki-Tiki at least once. They have a ton of stuff going on, lots of slides, music, contests, etc. Liki-tiki pool=FUN, exciting Orbit One=relaxing, enjoyable. The good thing is you have access to both. Staying in the Neptune building: the down side, the master bedroom faces highway 192 and since you have a big bay window instead of a solid wall, it doesn't provide much sound insulation. During that weekend, an ambulance was stationed at the gas station just outside our window and went on exactly 11 calls between 2 and 6 in the morning. Quite a few cars were squealing out and revving up engines in the wee hours of the morning. I figured it was safe to assume it wasn't the tourists in mini-vans, lol. We figured it was younger kids getting off the late shift at local businesses. It seemed to calm down during the week days. The other buildings do not appear to have bedrooms facing main roads..so you may want to try for one of their other buildings. Repairs: Like I said, the hot tub was under repair the entire week. We only got to use it the first day. It should be fine for any future stays. Here is the part where I got a little un-nerved though. Our room was on the third floor (no elevator x 5 people= many trips up/down the stairs to unload the car) We have no problem using stairs, but after we got everything unpacked and into drawers my oldest daughter went to get info about Liki-Tiki from the office. When she got back she said "here mom, they said they forgot to give you this" It was a letter stating that the power would be off that Tuesday from 9 am to 7pm due to switching out an electrical panel in our building. I was beyond mad, mainly because we chose to stay there because we brought food with us that needed to be in the fridge. I went back to the office ( this is when they handed me another letter they had forgot to give me about the hot tub being down) They were willing to move us to a different building ...after talking it over with my husband we decided not to ( just because we would have to pack everything back up, put it back in the car and unload it again and with our luck it would be on the 3rd floor again. We would just make plans to be gone that entire day and hope for the best with the food) The office was kind enough to give us 2 bags of ice to help keep it cool in the ice chest ....yes, there is a little sarcasm in my tone there. My only thought on this is: why would they just not put people in that building? The did not appear to be booked up and would have been able to relocate us. So why put us there to start with??? BUT, now the electrical panel is new..so, I think it was a one time thing that happened and shouldn't happen in the near future again. Location to Disney: Orbit One is located on "Entry Point Blvd" ... which turn into "Sherberth" across the intersection. You literally go across the intersetion and with in a half mile are on Disney property. It comes out right at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Which makes it easy to find your way back from the parks. Just follow the signs to Animal Kingdom Lodge and when you see it make a left , cross the intersection and you are back at Orbit One. Hardly no traffic to deal with. Overall: Would we stay again? Not sure, it depends on what our needs are. If you want a comfortable, clean place, close to Disney and you plan on just using it as a "base" to sleep (as long as you aren't in the Neptune building), eat and maybe swim a bit......its perfect. If you want a resort with activites to spend the time at on days when you aren't going to a park...not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tc2011
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect and were pleasently surprised. While not new, it was freshly painted and clean. We were surprised at how large the unit was. Full kitchen with full size appliances including dishwasher. Dishes, pots/pans... the works. Washer/dryer tucked in a closet area too. Shopped at a supermarket within walking distance. No shortage of gift shops and places to eat nearby. Went to Disney three times. We were in the parking lot within 10 minutes each time. My teenage son and daughter played tennis an basketball on-site with equipment borrowed from the office. I don't think you can beat this for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: poqal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Orbit One with my family of 5 to go to Disney World. the location is perfect, only 5 minutes from Disney. We walked in and it was very spacious and open. The living room, dining room and kitchen are all connected, and the bedrooms are off to the side. Pros: 1. The master bathroom has a huge jacuzzi tub that was just heaven after a long day walking around Magic Kingdom. 2. Beds were comfortable - a bit firm, but much better than we've slept on elsewhere 3. No time-share presentation was offered, which was a nice relief 4. Staff were very friendly. I needed to print out a UPS label and our boarding passes, and they accommodated me, and also provided parking passes to my parents who stayed with us one night. 5. Heated swimming pool. We didn't know it was heated, so we were kicking ourselves that we didn't bring our swimsuits! Cons: 1. No latch on front door - something to keep in mind if you have small children, since there's nothing to keep them from running outside 2. Sofa bed is ridiculously uncomfortable. If you need to accommodate more than four people I sugges you bring an air mattress 3. No free wi-fi ($8/day or $30/week)- however, there's a McDonald's right across the street that offers it so that worked for us the couple times I needed to use the internet (plus I had my iPhone in the meantime) All in all, we do plan to stay here again the next time we go to Disney. The whole family thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does the trip, but it's not pretty”
Reviews.Author: TandOsMom
Reviews.Content: This is certainly not a resort. The hotel is clean and plain. The rooms have a moldy / musty smell. The location is great. Overall, it was an OK place to stay, but we probably won't be returning. For just a little additional money, you can get a much nicer condo. My largest complaint was when we left something in the room after check-out, we called and asked if housekeeping turned it in. We even described the exact location where we left it. We have no idea if homekeeping stole it or what, but we never even got a call back. The front desk people were rude and the timeshare people were pushy. Oh, and when we checked in we weren't given our parking pass. Security asked that we go back to get one and we had to go to the timeshare desk to get the parking pass - very sneaky.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay and really great location !!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyCruiser
Reviews.Content: We have been here to 10 days, have 4 more to go. I think this resort is a great value. It is older, but that in no way detracts from all the good things about it. All the rooms are really large and it is very clean. When we had a problem with the master bathroom toilet stopping up, we called the office and in less than 15 minutes someone was here repairing it. We are in Gemini building and the pool is directly behind our villa. The pool is heated and it is never noisy when people are swimming at night. There is one thing we would like to have had, but most people do not need. We are both handicapped and the bathroom is not as easy as most. We called and asked for a chair for the tub and once again they responded immediately, so that made things a lot easier for us. I wish they had a hand held shower but that is the only things I would change. The spa tub in the master bedroom is absolutely huge. Don't hesitate to stay here. Since it is a 2 bedroom, we even had a friend fly down to visit for a week and he had his own room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Billinjaxbeach
Reviews.Content: We booked Orbit One Vacation Villas only about a month out. Nothing else reasonable was available. We are from Florida and used our Florida resident discount at Disney and Universal for the week of 12/25/10 to 1/1/11. The other favorable reviews pretty much say everything. I didn't expect the unit to be as nice as it was. It is an older timeshare complex but it looks like they are making improvements to keep things up to date. I talked to the manager one morning during their continental breakfast and he said the one thing that he wished was completed was a new exterior painting. You can see where they have it ready to paint. I could see new sod was laid not long ago. The grounds were kept up nicely. We'll definitely stay there again if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Who wrote the reviews?”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean63
Reviews.Content: Not any way close to what is stated on the reviews. Old and in need of updating and user friendly.Had I realized that facility was not what is shown in the pictures, I would have paid my $209 a night x 2 rooms to a place that was customer friendly. Had to leave due to 2yr old throwing up all night after one night of a two night stay and their attitude was "Oh well", no refunds. Not looking for a refund but perhaps a credit towards the $400 plus they had already credited my card plus an extra fee for crib, and $100 security fee....I I live in FL and could have come back at a later date but "that is not their policy" after prepaying for this reservation. NEVER ever prepay until you see what you are getting and look around, there are many places that are less costly than here and happy to accommodate guests.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lucky Find!”
Reviews.Author: LiseNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Disney and I am a nut about researching hotels. I spent over a week looking at reviews and than decided to book. At the last min, I saw Orbit One and decided to take a chance on a quick decision. Am I glad I did!! The suite was quite large with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Our master bathroom had a HUGH 2 person whirlpool tub (I think 4 would fit fine). The bed, sheets and pillows were one of the most comfortable we have slept on which was great after busy days at disney. Large dining room table. We didn't use the spare room as we didn't bring kids with us but lots of rooom for them with their own TV (there were 3 TVs in the suite). It was very clean and well stocked with everything we needed. It is only about an 8 min drive to Disney, close to lots of restaurants and you feel safe in the location. Staff were very friendly and helpful, including the guards at the gate. It was a very wonderful experience. We didn't use the pools but looked like lots of room for kids and adults. Our neighbor had just gotten back from the hot tub and said it was really hot like its supposed to be. We were in Neptune 8 and loved it. I would highly recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “This place was perfect for visit to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: SaskSkTraveller
Reviews.Content: We have 3 kids ages 4, 8, and 12 and we stayed at Orbit One for two weeks in October so that we could visit Disney World. We booked online thus we had no idea what to expect. We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived very late (1:30 am) and had no trouble getting our room keys from the security guard. We stayed in the Apollo complex which was near all the amenities. The condo was very bright, clean, and spacious. In fact, we couldn't get over how clean it smelled. The in suite laundry facilities were a real bonus, as was the dish washer. The pools were smaller than we imagined but turned out to be the perfect size for us. They were never busy (and were warm) so we had lots of fun using them and did not have to deal with crowds. This was important to us after a long day at the Disney Parks. My 12 year old son was thrilled that they had a basketball court (half-court only) and we also took some time to play tennis. The grounds were under construction so when we first arrive, the outside looked a bit bleak. However, during our two week stay we saw the place transform as the new sprinklers and lawn were installed. We heard that the next plan is to paint the outside of the buildings. This will give it a real facelift. What we liked most is that it was spacious and quiet. After spending the day at the Disney Parks we enjoyed the quietness of this condo. It is not a fancy resort so if that is what you are looking for this is not the place to stay, but, it is close to everything and has everything you need for a reasonable price. We did find the floors turned our feet black as another reviewer mentioned. I even took the time to wash the floors and they still turned our feet black. I think it was due to the fine dirt in the grounds due to the construction getting dragged in from our shoes. It was no big deal to us. We wore socks or shoes in the condo. Next time, I would bring slippers. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We had a few minor problems such as a leaking value on the toilet and a burned out light bulb which they fixed immediately. They even dropped off clean towels without us requesting them. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others are looking a reasonably priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: darvin1023
Reviews.Content: This place is Awesome. The villa has condos with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a fully equipt kitchen, patio, and livingroom, and washer/dryer. No timeshare pitch was ever thrown my way. 1. Location - The place was close to all the restaurants and gift shops in the main street. and a shot away from Animal Kingdom. Great Location 2. The Room . - Was clean. Bravo on the cleaning crew. The photos in the website really depict what the room looks like. - The AC was already on, and the room was already cooled as soon as we arrive. (and temp was in the high 90s F when were there) - We did not hear any noises from our neighboors. so I'm guessing the walls are thick enough. Hurray! 3. The amnities -Front Office, breakfast room and gym are located in the main building, and they open at 8am. - WIFI is NOT free. $30 for 7 days, - I wish the gym opens earlier so I could get my workout early in the morning (before the family wakes up), but for my 1st day the nice security man let me in the gym at 6am. - The kiddie pool was perfect for my 2 year old nephew. 4. Security - Its a gated resort, and gate always had a security guard at night, I felt safe that my car will not be vandalised, or get something stolen. But the neighborhood itself seems safe to walk about at night. 5. Con - The only thing i can find wrong was that the grounds was under upgrade/repair/renovation while were we there (because it was on the low seasons). So the grounds were not in their best form. 6. Extra bonus - There's free breakfast and coffee in the main office every weekdays (M-F). Nothing big, but since we had our own kitchen, i didnt get to taste their breaky. - For an extra $5, your whole party can use thier sister resort's waterpark. Again, a nice bonus if you came with lots of kids, but we didnt use since this place had 2 pools. - Free Parking - No Pets allowed. 7. Overall - I would stay here again. Its a nice, clean, and well maintained placed and very close to disney.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible place to stay in Orlando and/or Kissimmee!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyDad71
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 kids (aged 7 and 3) and I spent a week at Orbit One in July 2010. Having previously stayed at Orange Lake and Regal Palms, I can honestly say this is the best location anywhere in the Orlando area. Rooms are large and clean, the pools are clean, service is outstanding. Location is unreal - you have a direct road to Disney! There is karaoke on Tuesdays and a nice games room for the retro video game and pinball player traveller. Rooms have everything! There is not one bad thing to say about this property - a PERFECT STAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Convenient to Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: Tnhurley
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a week’s stay at Orbit One. We had a wonderful experience and will possibly stay there again next time we go to Orlando. The staff was friendly and efficient. Our check-in went smooth. We arrived early and our villa was not ready yet but it was ready to go by the guaranteed time. They also have fresh baked cookies at the counter. You will also receive a packet of brochures for area attractions so you will not have to pull them yourself. We received a courtesy call about an hour after check-in to see if everything was okay. Our coffee maker died on the fourth day and they brought us a brand new one within 30 minutes. The kitchen had all the basic utensils and dishes we needed for the week. The screened in patio has a ceiling fan w/light. Both bedrooms have televisions. The master bath has a nice whirlpool tub/shower combination. Water pressure was fine. The washer/dryer is apartment sized and perfect for washing a few things throughout the week. Wireless Internet service is available for a fee. The signal is good and we did not have any problems with it. The location was great. We were about 1.5 miles from Disney’s Magic Kingdom and right off the main parkway. We were directly behind Shoney’s and a Circle K market. The fitness center is not huge but has a treadmill, elliptical machine, two bikes and an all in one weight machine. The main pool has two water slides and the water was perfect. We spent a lot of time playing in the water in the evenings. The resort offers a continental breakfast during the week but we did breakfast in our villa. I cannot really think of anything we did not like about this resort. The pool closed at 11pm and it was quiet throughout the night. I had flowers delivered to my wife for our anniversary and the staff called and left us a message when they arrived. The security guards were polite and professional. Overall we were very pleased with this resort and look forward to visiting them again.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD GO THERE AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Theeagles_05
Reviews.Content: For our first family trip to Orlando, not knowing what to expect, this place was PERFECT! Clean, really spacious, when they say everything is included, everything is included... laundry detergent, to the bottle openner. We appreciated the fact that coffee and muffins were offered in the a.m. espacially for our first morning because we had arrived late that night. Loved the proximity of the pool and the fact that it was opened late (would have stayed in until midnight but we understand it has to close for the people staying close to the pool). Service desk was very friendly and helpfull. It really felt great coming back at night after a long day in the parks... you felt like coming back home... Just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN EXPECTED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindakn
Reviews.Content: This is a time-share complex. The pictures didn't do it justice. We checked into a two bedroom, two bath unit the last week of April. The unit they gave us was on the ground floor and right outside the pool. Parking was right outside the front door, too. o It had a very nice kitchen, nice tile floors, two bedrooms, two baths,(one with a spa tub) and a nice screened porch with an overhead fan. They have two TV's, DVD, and a CD radio. There was also a washer and dryer which is great to have when traveling. Everything was very clean!!! The location was about 5 minutes from Animal Kingdom and 10 minutes to EPCOT. We had great weather while there and went to Disney every day, sometimes even twice a day. With the kitchen, you can save money by making some meals and bringing snacks to the parks. We would go back there anytime. The front desk people were very friendly and there were donuts in the TV room every morning. They DID NOT bother us to listen to a time share spiel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Access”
Reviews.Author: marsworth75
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to this area and to this facility. The room was exactly as advertised. It was clean and the kitchen was well equipped. All he staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, particularly Jasmine at the front desk. This hotel could not have been better located for access to Disney without being on the Disney property itself. The only small negative was having to pay $30 bucks for wi-fi access for the week. We would definitely return to Orbit One if we return to vacation at Disney

Reviews.Title: “***FANTASTIC***”
Reviews.Author: LauraLew9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 2 weeks. When we arrived there was a security guard onsite letting cars in and out and the whole holiday I saw them out at night checking the hotel grounds! It made us feel much safer having that security onsite, also they were really friendly so that was a bonus. The room was spotless, everything we needed and more. It had a full kitchen and all utensils, all tvs were flatscreen, there was a balcony accessible from both the living area and the main bedroom. Pool is a great size, all staff very friendly. Within walking distance of many different eating places. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Orbit One”
Reviews.Author: curiousjp
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were able to check in early and request a ground level villa. Pleasantly surprised that they accommodated both requests without question. The villa was roomy and setup exactly as pictured, large bathtub was a plus. All utilities worked as expected. I did have to call maintenance to fix the lock, they arrived within 10 minutes and addressed issue. We enjoyed the pool at the front, kids were busy with the slides and kiddie area. Pool was well maintained. We did not take advantage of any of the planned activities, between the villas and liki tiki they offered many options. One Word: Location Very close to the maingate at Disney, in fact the road leading to the front entrance can be taken 1 mi (approx) north directly to Animal Kingdom. Close to restaurants, convenient stores, and souvenir shops. I had read many reviews, good and bad and had reservations about the place based on the reviews. Our experience was everything we expected, perfect. We were busy at Disney for five straight days so we did not sit through the time share breakfast, they did call the room phone to register us but we were never there to answer. I did notice one evening the phone ran at 6pm but we did not pick it up, point being when they do call it is not too late. We did purchase our own toiletries, Toilet paper, shampoo, etc... Locked ourselves out one evening going to the pool, a key was given to us without any extra charges. With all that said this is not the Polynesian, Beach Club or a five star hotel... it is a roomy villa with a full kitchenette, Washer and Dryer, two full baths, with amenities for family fun. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and would recommend and stay at Orbit One again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: LisaMickeyMania
Reviews.Content: We went expecting there to be faults, but I really couldn't find any ! We stayed in the Mercury building, which was perfect for us as it wasn't too near the pool but could see it enough to keep an eye on my daughter. Was really impressed with all the kitchen utensils provided, I can't think of anything that was missing. There was also a small welcome pack which included dishwasher tablets, washing up liquid, coffee, blueberry pancake mix . Absolutely nothing to complain about. Only one fixed hairdryer but this was no problem to us but may be to some people. Washer and dryer worked really well and the king size bed with crisp cotton sheets and duvet was wonderful after a long day in the parks. After a few days, housekeeping came to change the towels whilst we were out and they did this twice throughout our fortnight stay. Overall, would recommend to anyone and can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a timeshare in the area.”
Reviews.Author: boowaaccaa
Reviews.Content: For this stay we were with my MIL and FIL who had the master bedroom and we were in the other. We stayed for 2 weeks using my in-laws left over time shares. Interestingly enough the price we paid for the exchange and maintenance fees were more then it cost on expedia for the same 2 weeks. I have stayed at or visited family overnight in 7 different time share properties in the Orlando/Kissimmee area. We found this one to be about average. The staff was very friendly and mostly accommodating. The actual unit was a bit dated, but so has most of the other time shares we have stayed in, it was however very clean. In our second week they replaced all of our sheets with some beautiful new contemporary white duvet sets (we wondered why these weren't used in the first week). We found that the facility was a bit cheap as far as not providing shampoo etc and only one bar of soap per bathroom. Also the tp was so scratchy that my husband bought our own to use. Also they charge $30 a week for the internet and .75 cents for local calls and 1-800 calls. Even the flea bag hotels down the street at $17 a night include free highspeed internet and phone calls! Our room was at the front of the unit so it was sometimes noisy in the mornings with kids and families running up and down the stairs and talking/yelling to/at each other. My in-laws room was at the back of the unit facing a fence (and beyond the road) and they said their room was very quiet. We used both pools but preferred the back pool as it was heated as the weather was a bit chilly when we were there. I used the gym everyday and some days I would see no one and other days there would be a line up with no system to deal with it. In the mornings I saw a breakfast of sorts that included some pastries and coffee/tea. The resort overall was pretty small so that made it pretty quiet and kept everything close by. Personally I hate it when these resort are so big that you need to drive to get to the pool--this was by far not the situation at this place. We would stay here again for the right price but from what I have heard and seen there are many other places that are more updated for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: DisneyWorldrocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orbit One for one week at the end of Sept in the middle of a heat wave. Everyone was courteous, our room was fantastic... We just loved every minute. This was a family trip to DisneyWorld for me, my husband, and four kids. From the moment we arrived to the minute we left we enjoyed everything. The pool was great with two small water slides that was perfect for my kids. A little on the smaller side for my 10 & 12 yrs old but they still enjoyed it, but perfect for my 8 yr old. There was also a little kid area for my 4 yr old, although she wanted to be in the pool -which was huge - with all of us. They also had another pool but we didn't go there although it looked great. Our room was perfect with a kitchen and washer/dryer and the beds were set up perfectly. We even had ahuge jacuzzi tub/shower in the master bedroom. There was not one thing I would complain about our stay. In fact, we enjoyed our stay I am already trying to convince my husband that it's time to go visit Disneyworld and stay here again, already! If you choose this condo you will not be disappointed..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not as good as the Westgate down the street”
Reviews.Author: RayB73001
Reviews.Content: Nice small resort. Not much in amenities but you do get a nice, large, clean condo in a great location. Three stories but no elevator. Nice staff. Doesn't have the amenities as the Westgate Vacation Villas right behind it but is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Another great value stay”
Reviews.Author: AnonHerts
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from another great two week stay and it’s as good as ever. Nice, clean and spacious with everything you could want for a self catering holiday. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a good base to explore the theme parks and surrounding area and it is amazing value for money. I have to disagree with some of the earlier comments about décor, it might not be what you’d choose for your own home but it’s clean and comfortable. Staff are all helpful and friendly and the pool is lovely. Only niggles (and this is why it’s a 4 and not a 5 rating) we phoned ahead and asked for an apartment towards the back of the complex as we like peace and quiet. I appreciate that requests can’t always be accommodated but we were given an apartment in Gemini directly behind the Jacuzzi, perhaps the nosiest spot possible. There were also no nets in the lounge which meant no privacy when the pool was in use unless you closed the curtains. No biggie, I appreciate, but if peace and privacy is important you might want to make sure you’re placed elsewhere. For the first few days we also received daily calls encouraging us to come along for a timeshare presentation again no problem, just irritating, and we ended up leaving the phone off the hook. The internet connection was dodgy to say the least, I have no problem with the cost, only that it took ages to send an e-mail. Again something to be aware of if like us you need to be in contact. These niggles aside we love staying here and always have a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A true bargain among Kissimmee hotels!”
Reviews.Author: KR4WM
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews others wrote. We saw no ants. Bottom line, if you don't like insects, don't vacation in the south! Our room was clean, and all was as expected, if not better. Especially considering the price we paid for our stay ($67.00 per night)! In fact, we've stayed at the Westin resort complex with friends before, and the rooms were laid out practically identical! Our problems were few, were not major, and consisted of: the light in the childrens room, which was insufficient. There was only a single lamp, and it's not enough light for a room, and with the "energy efficient" type lighting, you had to wait 10 minutes after turning it on to see anything. The other problem was the dryer duct must have had a birds nest in it, as after 3 hours of run-time, clothes were still wet/damp. But- you don't get your own washer/dryer in most hotels, so just having one in the room was a plus. The only other thing I consider a problem was that they wanted to charge us $30 for a week of wireless internet access. Most hotels these days are FREE. Both bedrooms had their own TV and the living room had a nice large flat-screen and comfortable furniture in good condition. The cable line up was adequate, considering we weren't on vacation to watch TV. The hot tub by the pool was nicely hot, and the large pool with two slides was warm enough to swim. We felt secure because a guard was on duty 24 hours a day, even though the neighborhood seemed nice enough not to need one. The desk help was polite and helpful. The only thing that put me off is that it is a time share setup, and I despise the time share business, having witnessed dozens of them go bust in Myrtle Beach where I'm from and saw many tourists lose thousands of dollars of their hard earned money on them. I thank my lucky stars that I booked the place as a hotel and was not forced to waste an hour of my life on a time share tour! Skip the "free" breakfast if you have any sort of appetite. It's micro-sized muffins, coffee, and juice. There are dozens of places to eat within walking distance, including a Golden Corral. One of my grandkids got a cough, and Walgreens is about 1 mile away. Dunkin' Donuts is also very nearby, but don't expect the help there to speak English as a primary language. Dunkin Donuts employees and manager neither know what the "Orlando kids eat free" card is, even though they are advertised as participants, and they'll just hand your card back to you with your change without giving you any discount. You might get away with giving them exact change and refusing to pay a penny more, but they had my money and left me with no recourse. When I asked for a refund they just took the next customer in line and pushed me aside. No more Dunkin Donuts for me! RUDE! Disney Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, and Epcot are a very short distance across the highway from Orbit One. Set your GPS to take you to Animal Kingdom. Setting my Garmin GPS to Magic Kingdom took me an extra 8 miles or so unnecessarily, and all three entrances are in the same place. The route to Animal Kingdom was much shorter. We enjoyed all the Disney parks, with the exception that they encourage line-cutting. If you visit, you'll see what I'm talking about. They tell you to step around the people in front of you if they don't hear the "command" to move up tighter. Disney herds you through rides like cattle. The rides are enjoyable, but this practice kind of put me off. We got 'tard seats in "It's a bugs life" (stationary seats for people who get disturbed easily by motion) because they allowed too many people into the attraction at once. Orbit One is a bargain, all things considered!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shocker816
Reviews.Content: We rented a two bedroom Dec 13-20 to accomodate extended family attending a graduation. The facility is older, but fairly up to date and well maintained. It has a good pool with tube slides, a modest work out facility and very polite, attentive personnel. We managed to rent an additional villa for two nights when we had additional family members arrive for the main event. It is a block off 192 behind a Shoneys and near a very good Indian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Time, helpful staff, large villas--a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Happy2GetawayNow
Reviews.Content: We decided to drive to down to Florida for the first week of November (if you can go down this week, DO IT-- parks are less crowded, discounts on tickets, etc.) and we ended up pulling into the resort around 6:30 on Sunday night. The staff was helpful, quick and when I was asked to get my parking pass from the other desk (something I knew meant that I'd be "hit up" for a time-share like meeting) the girl there talked to me for only a couple of minutes and gave me an invitation to a breakfast/lunch thingee, didn't ask for a commitment just then, then never bothered us again. After all, we were there for Disney! Regarding location, I don't know how you can get any better! You just make a left out of the parking lot, go through the light at 195 down this little side road (Sherberth) and within minutes you are at Animal Kingdom. Make a right at the next light then continue down Osceola Pkwy and you'll be at all the other parks in minutes. Remember, though, to factor in parking, taking the tram, then taking the monorail (if you're going to the Magic Kingdom). The first few days we decided to bring the kids back to the villa for naps and it took us nearly 1/2 hr just to get from the MK to our car. The rest of the week we just took 2 strollers and pushed them through and it was so much better. The villas themselves were AWESOME. Our kids had their own room w/ their own bathroom and we had a HUGE room w/ a king size bed and an enormous jacuzzi (we could all fit in that thing!). The kitchen was well stocked w/ plates, cups, mugs, frying pans, utensils, even tupperware type containers to store leftovers in. We made our own breakfasts and brought light lunches to the parks each day (bring a softsided lunchbox w/ drinks and snacks). We even packed sandwiches for the kids-- why pay huge prices for kids who just want PB&J anyhow? Then we ordered food for ourselves for lunch and ate at the parks for dinner, or came back to the room for ziti, tacos, hot dogs, etc. Plus the villas are so quiet (we never heard anyone in our block) and the kids slept just fine every night. My only complaint was that the window in their room didn't have black-out curtains so the sun shone in early in the morning and they got up (much too early for our liking). The bedding was thick and heavy (not threadbare or worn), the couches were ok, and our mattress was firm. All the negative comments I had seen about decor and paint were ridiculous. I mean, I'd never decorate my own home in bold flowery prints, but hey, we were in Florida not in my own home. The place was so comfortable, there were THREE tvs, a huge refrig, microwave, stove, etc. Gimme a break! We stayed in the Mercury building, second floor, just for reference. Now there were a few issues when we were there. Our upstairs neighbors had a leaky valve in their plumbing, so we woke up one morning to a soaked countertop in our bathroom. Within 15 minutes maintenance was there to fix the problem and we didn't have an issue with it for the rest of the week. Then toward the end of the week the resort had a water main break. They had to turn off the water (we had been at Disney all day), then when we got back and saw that our water was off we called the main office and Chris (one of the staff) ran around for nearly an hour trying to find a villa we could either move to, or just use to shower in. He gave us keys to the new villa but then 1/2 hr later our water was back on and we were happy as clams. At first it seemed like it was going to be a big deal but it turned out to be just fine. I really appreciated Chris' efforts. Another great feature was the washer/dryer. We went home w/ all clean clothes and only had to pack half of what we normally would. Just run down the road (less than a mile) to the Marketplace Winn-Dixie or Super Target and stock up on food and supplies. Do NOT go to the little stores that say "supermarket"-- everything at those places is double or triple their normal prices, like buying groceries at a gas station convenience store. One thing we did not like was the tile on the floors that made the kids' socks pretty dirty but at least I could chuck them into the washer and have clean ones by the next day. Also to note, we stayed here w/ an RCI certificate that cost us less than $200 for the entire week (and included Wi-Fi, which we used). This was a very special rate as it was a gift, and therefore allowed us to overlook the little issues that happened during our stay. Because where else could we stay that offered this much for this little? We'll definitely be making a return trip here next year. Oh, and they were updating and painting a bunch of other villas while we were there, so there's obvious upkeep and upgrading of the rooms. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me. And enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: klkeh
Reviews.Content: The villas were nice. Nothing fancy but enough room for everyone. Some of the other reviews said the rooms were dirty. I noticed a little mold behind the bathroom door where the shower over sprayed onto the floor in the master bedroom but other than that everything was clean. Kids loved having their own room with twin beds and TV. Master bedroom had king size bed and master bathroom with huge whirlpool tub. We could have fit the whole family in the tub.
