Kitchen was stocked with the basics. Laundry in the room was very convenient. Villas were 5-15 minutes from attractions, close to many restaurants, gas stations and grocery stores. There were 2 pools, one had 2 slides, other had no slides. Pool area was clean with many chairs and tables. Water was warm and refreshing. We took advantage of using the waterpark at Liki Tiki Villas. The kids had a blast. We went there for $5 for the day. It was about 5 minutes down the road. Staff were very nice and accommodating. Our air conditioner stopped working and within a few minutes maintenence came and fixed it. They even called back an hour later to makes sure it was ok. Our favorite thing about the villas were the location. We were so close to everything. This is not a fancy hotel but it was decent for the money. We stayed there for a per night fee, not a time share. Some of the reviews talked about the time share people bothering them. We were never contacted by any time share people the whole time we were there. We stayed 7 nights and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: dawn704
Reviews.Content: Overall we were pleased with our stay and would stay again. We stayed a week. It is an older place like stated in other reviews, but they do a nice job of keeping it up, and it's clean and comfortable. The inside is remodeled and very spacious. Much better than staying in a hotel. It's a great place for 2 people or a family with 1 or 2 small children. It's in a great location and close to everything including the parks. The only complaints we had was the washer and dryer is very small and it takes forever, but eventually does the job. We specifically asked to be in a quiet section which for the most part it was, but several mornings the construction workers were parked right outside our unit (we were on the end) and walking right by our patio and windows often so we kept the blinds closed on those days. They get there early too. One morning we awoke to 4 dump trucks, several other utility trucks and workers installing meters right infront of our patio and bedroom area. They cut the electricity off for a few hours and did not notify anyone including the office, that they were doing so. That was really the only major problem we had during our stay. Just ask to stay somewhere away from the construction/remodeling area. We asked to stay somewhere quiet and thats where they put us! During the day and at night it was quiet and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: heartfull
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeklong stay at Orbit One, and our accommodations at Orbit were one of the highlights of our Disney vacation. We arrived about 4:30PM last Saturday, and check in was a breeze, with VERY friendly and efficient hosts, and no high pressure-sales-pitch. Our rooms in the Apollo building were very nice and clean, beds comfy, kitchen well furnished with place settings for 8. The kids enjoyed the pools almost every day (but I preferred the garden tub in the master bath!) The location is so convenient to Disney, taking the shortcut straight across I92 via Sherbeth Road to Osceola Parkway, and a nice clean place to come home to each night. On our early nights home from the parks, it was nice to be able to prepare our own dinners. This is not a luxury resort, but I do recommend Orbit as a clean, comfortable, safe place to stay, especially if you are in Orlando to do Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired & clapped out. Avoid”
Reviews.Author: poggsuk
Reviews.Content: Arrived here on sunday 4th October. Check in area fine and deserted. Had to speak with the timeshare sales guy to get the parking permit etc. bit of a pain as he tried to get me to attend the holiday club sales pitch nonsense. Eventually escaped and headed for the room. The condos are arranged in blocks surrounding a central pool area. the pool area seemed to be fairly well maintained and was utterly deserted. On reaching the room we parked outside the block. no other cars to be seen. The block had horrid concrete painted brown walls that was not friendly. Go to the 2nd floor room and entered. found a long open plan kitchen / lounge that was simply old and dated. It did have a LCD tv stuck on top of a dresser at the end, seemingly as an after thought. There was a balcony but it looked really grotty and we never went outside. The bedrooms had old beds that seemed to sag in the middle and squeek when I sat on them. THe walls were horrible white painted contrete with no attempt to smarten them up with wallpaper or a plaster skim, simply bare concrete wall. Yeuch! We never even bothered to unpack and simply left the resort less than 30 minutes after arriving. There is no way we would stay here, regardless of the price. However I am a little fussy. If you think that motel 6 or econo lodge are acceptable then the orbit one would fit your need nicely. Otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY MARVELOUS”
Reviews.Author: beautifulk
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Florida for the first time w/ my fiancee and 11 year old daughter. My family was very happy with the accomodations provided by Orbit One. We loved the full size kitchen, which we found very spacious. The only shock I personally had was on the first day we checked in , the kitchen is the first room you enter from main door and there was the HUGE spider on the wall.I am afraid of spiders so of course I freaked out. Needless to say, he did not bother us for the rest of our stay thanks to my trusty fiancee who saved the day. Anyway, I greatly enjoyed the huge tub/jacuzzi in the master bedroom. I highly recommend if you stay there to try the tub with bubblebath. Its a blast! My daughter loved having her own room with cable tv and her own bathroom. We also enjoyed having the private balcony. It was fun to sit outside at night and just enjoy the peace and quiet. You can also access the balcony from the masterbedroon as well as he livingroom. It was convenient having the washer/dryer in the room also but I could not get the washing machine to work. My daughter and I rally enjoyed the swimming pool towards the fron of the Hotel because it has the 2 slides. My daughter made new friends and had a ball. Our room was clean and the staff was awesome. We intend to go back to Florida again in 2010 and we completey intend to stay at orbit one again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY HELPFUL WHEN MOSTLY NEEDED”
Reviews.Author: migsambo
Reviews.Content: We visited Orlando just recently and were planning to stay for only 2 days at the Staybridge Intl. Drive, but instead we decided to extend with two more days and Orbit 1 was the only one hotel/resort that would offer us the commodity pf a spacious suite room for 6 persons. We tried all hotels in Intl. Drive and 192 Irlo Bronson, but without any luck. All hotel rooms were sold out. We booked online and we were very pleased with the service. Although we checked in earlier, at 10 am, we requested a suite on the ground floor which we got and our room was already waiting for us. We enjoyed our 2 extra days in the spacious suite. Our room smelled clean and we were very pleased. We will certainly return to Orbit One. MSambo, Curacao

Reviews.Title: “Excellent As Always”
Reviews.Author: WillTraveler73
Reviews.Content: Orbit One has been a part of our family and extended families summers since 1984. My immediate family traveled there in mid July '09 after six year hiatus. Still a nice place to spend a week while visiting the theme parks in the area. It's one of the older resorts on 192 but it's been kept in excellent condition over the years. Since our last trip in '03 the units have been remodeled and the main pool at the front of the complex has been revamped (new slides and water feature). Looking forward to visiting again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “what a good time!”
Reviews.Author: chase26
Reviews.Content: MY friends and i had an amazing time there. ive been going here for years this place is so nice to stay i would recomend it to everyone. i never had to complain about anything. There is so many activities to do....we couldnt do all of them in a week. the pools are great never over crowded.. the staff was always friendly. They have breakfast in the morning it was allways good! it was just a fun and relaxing trip!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION,FELT SECURE,GOOD PLACE TO STAY WITH FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: NBfamily
Reviews.Content: We zeroed in on Orbit One using TripAdvisor and found the good reviews written here accurate. It has everything you need to be comfortable. Super location and very close to anywhere you want to go. The 192 that it is located just off of has many places to eat,shop etc. Just a few miles to Disney,very close to I-4. With traffic, it took us about a half hour to travel to and get parked at Universal. Orbit One was opened in '83, so it's not new but has been upgraded. If you look hard enough it shows a little aging, but we really liked it anyway(I show a lil aging too,lol). If you need 5 star accomodations, go elsewhere. I rank it as a strong 3 star. It has a guarded entry gate(nice guys but not staffed at night tho) and the grounds are surrounded by a 6' fence. It has two nice pools,outdoor activities like dual tennis courts,shuffleboard, a basketball net, a raquetball court and bbq's(briquet style) and the grounds are very nice. The staff were cordial and attentive. The villas are well appointed with everything you need to survive, including a blender. The only thing my daughter noticed was there is no hairdryer in the main bathroom but there is a wall mounted type in the master bath suite,so bring an extra. Other than that it's fully equipped including newer appliances. We were very comfortable there and we will definately stay there again. We stayed in the "Saturn" building. Each building is named after planets. Somebody else here mentioned the Neptune building balconies faced into the Shoneys parking lot and they weren't happy there. I can say that I don't blame them. That is the only building there that had an objectionable view. The business center there had only 2 pc's, but you must pay a daily rate of $8 or a weekly rate, I can't remember it ,but it was the best choice. Or...you can do as we did, just go down to the pc and see if it will work for you because if a previous user signs on but didn't sign off...your in. At no added expense to them either btw. We found that most of the time one or both the pc's were left like that, So if it's not that important to you, save your money and take your chances. We didn't have a laptop to have taken advantage of their wifi. Go and have fun ppl.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Iamfloridaflower
Reviews.Content: Our family of four thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We felt the condo was very clean. The staff very friendly and helpful. I exchanged my dirty towels every day for clean ones. You're given small soap, asked for larger and was given it. The maintenance people are around the grounds making sure things are running top notch, making sure pool is clean in morning , trimming hedges, cutting grass. Will definitely use this condo in the future.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful Experience"”
Reviews.Author: railguncat
Reviews.Content: We purchased an RCI Timeshare rental online and did not know exactly what to expect when we arrived. The accomandations were spacious, cleaner than expected, and was a great bargain. The location is perfect for visiting DisneyWorld (5 miles from condo to front door to parking lot for Animal Kingdom. Lots of restaurants within walking distance of condo. We found the staff to be very helpful - the check-in is until 11:00pm! Guardhouse is manned and we felt very secure. The condos offer a free continental breakfast Monday through Friday. I would definitely return to Orbit One Vacation Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for kids”
Reviews.Author: Disneyjunkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while visiting Disney World. We traveled with four adults, and two boys, age 2 and 5. We stayed in the Apollo building, which is centrally located. It was very quiet, even though just next to the pools, playground and tennis courts. I don't know the normal rates, we booked it through the military vacation deals, and would definitely do it again. Yes, the floors turned your feet black quickly, and they provide minimal starting out household items (two dishwasher tablets, two laundry soaps, two extra TPs) but you can buy your own from the local stores or from them. Other than that, the place was very clean, spacious, and we had no problems with things being old or not working. I'm sure they've made some improvements since some of the older bad reviews. The service was great. They called twice in the first two days just to make sure we had everything we needed. We had no problems with bugs. There were three TVs, not two. They have DVD players, not VHS. All the appliances and plumbing looked new and we had no problems. We didn't use the sofa bed. We rented a pack n play for the week, and my older son slept on the cushion from the love seat on the floor. The beds were very comfortable and we slept great. The kids loved this place. They had room to run around and play, rather than being cramped at a hotel. They enjoyed the pool (which also has a fun waterfall area to stand and play in) and the playground. We also checked out a bunch of balls for the raquetball court and spent an hour just bouncing balls off the walls. The bathtub was enormous and made bathtime for two boys very quick, fun and splashy. And it was so nice to be able to put them to bed in one room and be able to stay up later watching tv or talking and not disturb them. Lastly, the location is perfect. Disney is so close, it only took a few minutes. It's right next to plenty of tourist shops, McD's, Denny's and many nicer places to eat. It's also just a few minutes between a walk-in-clinic in one direction, and the hospital in the other, which we unfortunately had to make use of. This was an ideal place to stay. I would pick this setting over a hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT WEEK!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shalinntor
Reviews.Content: This condo was everything my family of five needed for a week at Disney World!! It is literally a five minute drive to Disney!! The resort has two pools, we just used the one in front. (We were in Gemini building, 2nd floor, directly overlooking the front pool and guard shack) My son is 11 and he enjoyed the pool, and the two water slides. It is heated, so it feels great even on cooler days. The hot tub was amazing for soaking after a long day at Disney. There are plenty of chairs and tables around. It was clean everyday!! The condo was great. Very roomy. My kids are 17, 15, and 11, and we all had plenty of room to relax. Having two full bathrooms was great with two teenage girls!! It only took us 45 minutes for all of us to be up and showered. The washer and dryer were awesome too. I did some laundry while we were there, and it was great to be able to dry our swimsuits and towels from swimming. The screened in patio was awesome, no bugs. It also has a fan so that it keeps it cool while you are relaxing. The kitchen is stocked with everything you need and has a full size fridge and an ice maker in the freezer. The beds were very comfortable for a hotel/resort. I have been in some that are really horrible, and these were nice. I would recommend bringing: laundry soap/ fabric softner dishwasher tabs extra tp your own beach towels (they have towels by the pool, but they are really small) Super Target is about 1-2 miles away. Turn left onto Hwy 192 and it will be on the left. There are lots of restaurants nearby as well as a Publix across the street from Super Target. There are also alot of gift shops around there, so if you are going for Disney you can save some money. Internet: They charge for wireless internet, but offer free internet in the front office. I was actually able to connect to their wireless office from my balcony, but couldn't get it in the condo. I would definetly go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Friendly Staff and plenty of room”
Reviews.Author: Weezor98
Reviews.Content: This was so much better then staying in a cramped hotel. We could cook a quick breakfast before going off to spend the day at the parks. It was spacious, clean and comfy. We could come home to get a good nights rest and do it all over again the next day. We had a problem with the washer and the maintenance staff was there in 5 minutes to fix. They were courteous and helpful. They even have things to do each day, if you didn't want to do the parks. We are going to try the water park associated with Orbit One the next time. We would definetly stay here again and have already recommended it to other family members.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Majestic69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here thru RCI and found it to be pretty nice. We didn't have high expectations going in so that might have helped. It's not a fancy place but quite simply just a nice place overall. The rooms are spacious and clean and we liked that it had all the appliances there. Overall a nice place to take the family! We might do it again in 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wifeUSMC
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Orlando hotels I am used to the fact that most are very well worn and even when new seem tired so after seeing the pictures of Orbit One Vacation Villas I was expecting a mediocre at best experience. Thankfully we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly and unusually helpful. The pool and hot tub was the cleanest and nicest we have ever seen and the water temperature was perfect. After a grueling day at Disney we would come back and all four kids would swim for 2 hours. The waterslides kept them entertained. During our stay it was very quiet and was not a resort for any party scene but was great for kids and parents/grandparents. The location was ideal though there is no shuttle to Disney. Do not go here expecting five star hotel experience. If you want room service and frills go somewhere else and pay a lot more but for a budget minded traveler this is a clean and convenient vacation spot with plenty to keep young children happy.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us-unbeatable price”
Reviews.Author: dawn5851
Reviews.Content: First I will say this review is coming from folks from jersey with 2 teenage boys. We arrived early at about 2pm and our room was not ready, but Nancy at the desk tried very hard to get us in, but no luck. We were able to use the pool, change rooms, game room etc. and there are free towels provided poolside. When we did get in the room ($73-expedia for 9 nights) couldn't be more impressed. We were in Saturn 3rd floor. Big clean and stocked, so I'm not sure of the other reviews? We caught the cold snap, so be warned units are not heated and did have a chill in the master due to the huge window--but I lived! My view on the balcony was of the second mellow- pool, bb courts, tennis courts and picnic area with "putting green" kinda lame and lotsa fallen leaves so you really couln't putt. This was great for me because my boys made friends with about 6-7 other boys the same age and they played hoops and football every night. I couln't see nor hear them at the main pool with hot tub....so folks with little ones may want to requeat a room around the kid pool/club house. The property itself is actually very small by disney townhouse/condo standards, which I loved! About 2 blocks around. It is gated and guarded for most of the time--LOVE that. I will say if you have a stroller ask for a 1st floor. No elevators and all your condos will have a door on the back porch opening up to sidwalks for the wee ones. The exits out front do force you to walk in the parkinglot cause there are no sidewalks? So I might be nervous with little ones (toodlers) and why stress on vaca? My boys used the game room alitlle--mini airhockey and 8 good games -all in working order. I used the internet in the cafe one day and you need to pay a small fee with visa or mc only and set up a temp acct. Even to use your lap top requires this. The room was fab- big master suite with a jacuzzi tub big enough for 2+ (nice for a couple to have some romance during the trip--make the time!) All the beds were pillow top and tons of drawer and closet space. Safe easy to use. It seemed each condo has its own small h2o heater and air unit, we had no water pressure problems or anything. Bring or buy laundry soap and dish washer soap (they give you 2 days worth). The only "down" side and to me it was no biggy is there is no maid service. Now I was doing a load everymorning during my coffee/mom time while everyone slept so I didn't mind throwing in the towels. This may bother some. This is not your place then. I only found out on day 8 that on request you can borrow a vacume and mop--too late for me then but I would have on day 5. There is a broom and dust pan and an iron&board. This was worth it to me for the price and location and $ I save on only using 1 checked bag on the flight (each had a carry-on). Speaking of location--wonderful. 3 min to epcot/mgm 5 to MK and the side rode your on takes you right to animal kingdom 2min. I got "home" before my girlfriend who was staying at Old Key West on Disney property. You can walk to the super K/denn'y/dunkin donuts and more in under 3 min. THe keys work out well for the kids. They are cards and they can get wet. The kids also use them to trade in at the front dest when they take equipment to play with. They have a soday and water machine on premisis and my 16yr old used the small but decent weight room. Thats all-I thought it was great. Just big enough to have space inside and out yet small enough to let the kis run free and super close to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jujumommie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 7 days while visiting disney. I was hesitant and concerned b/c of some neg reviews but I have to say, I was very pleasantly surprised. It was extremely clean (I bought a mop and chlorox to clean the floors and found didn't need to!!!), the units look just as pictured. They werent super new or luxurious but for the price point I think you can't go wrong. There are two pools, one larger with a slide, a fountain and a whirlpool and the other smaller and quieter. Both were nicely heated. The staff was very courteous, they tried the time share sales brkfst thing, we simply said no and that was that. It was very close to all disney parks (prob 5 min drive). It is located just off of a main strip with restaurants, shops, walgreens and supermarkets (a large publix 3 miles down). I wouldn't think twice about staying here when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for large families”
Reviews.Author: aruba1983
Reviews.Content: We got rooms at this resort through our time-share company. I travelled with a large group (16 adults, 5 children). We were able to get four units next to each other, all ground level. I guess it wasn't a busy period. Late September/Early October. I think this is the best time to visit Disney, short waiting time for most rides. The units are large! the master bedroom and bath are very spacious. Large TV's in both bedrooms and living room. Full kitchen with large fridge. There is a washer and dryer in every unit. And the resort gives you free detergent. They also give you dishwashing detergent. One evening, the kids went to the pool and used the bath towels, so I called front desk and within 5 minutes, they brought us clean bath towels. There is wireless internet availble, free of charge but only in the lobby area. They do have computers to go on the internet, but you have to pay for this. I cant remember how much it was. But get the weekly rate, it's much cheaper than the daily rate. The hotel is located conveniently off US-192. We could not hear any traffic from our rooms. It is very easy to get to and from the parks. There is a McDonalds accross the street (192). We walked to it one night. We felt safe. There is a security guard at the gate during the day. At night they walk around the building and check if all the cars are registered at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time, not as good as first”
Reviews.Author: MllePookie
Reviews.Content: Redeemed through RCI. Our first stay at Orbit One was in Oct. of 2007. We LOVED it and told ourselves we wouldn't stay at anywhere else. It was a great value and the rooms, even tho they were a little older, were clean and spacious. This year we went in December and had a far different experience. The room was technically the same but felt far different. 1. The toilet wouldn't flush. You had to hold down the handle for the entire cycle to get it to flush down. 2. The stopper in the Jacuzzi in the bathroom was broke. Couldn't retain water. 3. Couldn't get through a shower without having it run out of hot water 4. We weren't given a brillo pad to wash the dishes and pots with. Even after going to the front desk and asking for something, they told us they didn't have anything available. I remembered our last time staying there we were given one and it came in quite handy. Furthermore, as we were leaving on the last day, I saw brillo pads in the starter packs that were to be prepped for incoming guests. 5. Overall feel was old and grungy. The bathrooms looked outdated and old. Soap melts super fast and is gone within 1 or 2 uses. Altho the front desk will give you more if you ask for it, still a good idea to bring your own stuff so you don't have to keep asking. Overall it was ok but not nearly as impressive as I remembered last year. It seems like we got one of the better units the first time and one of the worse units this go-around. Unfortunately I won't be going back. I'll look for elsewhere next year.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back to Orbin One”
Reviews.Author: misskim5684
Reviews.Content: We booked this thru RCI. I definitely was shocked it was rated a "silver crown". The staff was not friendly at all and not very helpful. When we did go down to the desk the girls were eating pizza and had grease on the counter. During the week we wanted some information on Sea World. We were told the person who handles that wouldn't be back until Saturday. In addition, they state they have several activities going on. However, I went down for water aerobics and the girl that was suppose to lead it, stated that she doesn't go in the water after September. Keep in mind it was 87 degrees that day. On Saturday morning, we went down to get the free continental breakfast and was notified that the free continental breakfast is not on the weekends. The facility is very run down including the grounds. The inside of the rooms, however, were decent and spacious. The information says there are garden windows in the room with plants..Our garden window in the bedroom had a slab of board down on the bottom and paint was peeling all over. One positive thing is you didn't have to fight for a place by the pool or to use the weight room (since no one was there). Others that were there that we did meet at the pool stated they were also very disappointed. I do not recommend this for anyone!!!! We will not be back

Reviews.Title: “good family place”
Reviews.Author: onnick
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with our four children. The resort was a great place for the kids. We were less than 10 minutes to Disney. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and spacious. I would highly recommend it for families looking to be close to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Lots of facilities”
Reviews.Author: Nottingham_8
Reviews.Content: We are are family of 6 just returned from this hotel/apartment after a pleasant 2 week stay. Really good value. Not 5 star but definitely clean and family friendly. The rooms are large with just about eveything you could need. We ate in every other night and were able to cook full meals. Large cooker and fridge. 2 bathrooms, 3 TVs. Clean towels twice a week. There is a full size washing machine and a seperate dryer which came in very useful.Lots of other facilities, our children range from 9 to 18 and they were well occupied on our half days off from the Parks. The pool kept them entertained for hours and the jacuzzi is amazing, really hot, and best of all they are both open until 11 at night so even after an evening out we could enjoy a dip in the pool. One suggestion - request an upstairs room as we were given a ground level room at first which smelt damp so we requested an upstairs room and were transferred straight away and the room was absolutely fine. Well situated for Disney and not too far away from Universal just a pleasant drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not sure if I would come back!”
Reviews.Author: mishbrown
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through RCI. We used our points to stay for 2 weeks. It was our first time using RCI and I would not recommend following their "crown" scale. They said this was silver crown resort....I would beg to differ. We arrived early, before check in a 4pm and we were given a room right away; which was nice. We were housed in the Mercury building on the end. The rooms are showing signs of age. Paint pealing in the bathroom, wallpaper missing etc. While checking in we were handed our keys and told to see "Jennifer" at the desk behind us. She welcomed us to the "resort" as if she was an employee and offered us breakfast or lunch. She said to reserve our space we would have to pay $20.00 which we would get back once we arrived at the breakfast. She told us there was some info, for a "new vacation program." My husband and I quickly asked her if it was a timeshare presentation....SHE SAID NO. Since we have had experiences with times shares, we were NOT interested one bit to go through that crap again! Low and behold, the next morning was arrived at he breakfast....to be greeted by the SHARKS! The whole feel had timeshare all over it! We were taken up stairs and offered breakfast! WHAT A FARSE...the had apples, donuts, coffee and juice! What a great breakfast! (Can you feel the sarcasm?) After over an hour and a half, we were finally "allowed" to leave. We were given our $20.00 back in the form of a Visa gift card with an additional $80.00. I know you may be thinking, "well you got $80.00 for free." I'd would rather not have it! TIMESHARE presentations are not fun in any way shape or form! Once we got back to our "resort" I spoke to the Manager Tom; who was lovley! He told me that he gets these complaints at least 2 times a week. My question is why do they allow these people in the front lobby to LIE to their guests. It makes the resort look bad too! After complaining ( 3 times) to the "guest service" people that sent us on the timeshare presentation, we received a "free" lunch in Celebration. I will say that I had a wonderful time in Celebration, the city was "perfect" in a Stepford Wives" type of way! THE RESORT: The rooms are large, 2 bedrooms, with a pullout. We had our 4 kids with us, and they slept fine! The floors were filthy. They looked clean, but if you walked around without shoes on, your feet were BLACK! Other than that, it was clean ( I think) 2 pools...1 with 2 water slides, the kids loved it! The sauna was on again, off again....not in the best shape. Tennis courts Shuffle board Basketball BBQ's...which my husband LOVED! Security at the front enterance and walking around at night Walking distance to McDonalds, Denny's, Ponderosa, Sizzlers etc. 15 min. drive to Universal 5 min drive to Disney In room safe BAD STUFF: 5.99 a day or 29.99 a week to use WiFi! Go to the McDonalds across the street and have a coffee to use theirs for FREE $.80 a call (even to 1-800's) Don't use your calling card from here! NO shuttle to any park! They will call one for you are YOUR CHARGE! Liki Tiki (you only pay for parking $5.35, but you are NOT allowed to bring ANY food or drinks with you for the day!) You MUST buy their expensive small portion food!!! Don't waste your time! The water slides right at Orbit are comparable! ________________________________ I would say it is a nice hotel complex, I would not classify this a resort. I would come back if I had limited hotel choices, but I would much rather stay at a "RESORT" style complex

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel17
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and loved the resort. We arrived early (12:00) and they found an available room for us. Check in wasn't suppose to be until 4pm. The rooms were big with plenty of space for 4-6 people. Apparently they have been recently renovated. Everything looked new to include kitchen and bedding. The bed was so comfortable, we pulled the sheets off to see the manufacturer. The screened patio was terrific. Even had a ceiling fan for warm days. Felt like you were in the tropics with the view from our patio of all the lush greenery. Kitchen was well supplied. The welcome bag was really appreciated. Having toilet paper,paper towels, dish soap, and dish rags was a relief. Wasn't sure if we would need to run to the store immediately. The jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom was huge. Like the safe in the room also. We locked up extra money and credit cards when we went to the parks. The property has two pools and beautiful grounds. The location couldn't be better. We had restaurants and all the parks within a few minutes. The place is geared towards families so don't expect a "partying" crowd. Having peace and quiet was wonderful. A continential breakfast with coffee, juice and pastries was available in the main building ever morning. Only suggestion would be to request first floor rooms if you have physical disibilities since there are 2-3 levels and no elevators. The sound insulation within the floors isn't great. We had several small children above us. They liked to run back and forth. Didn't bother us since they went to bed early. Staff was friendly and courteous. Would highly recommend the resort and plan on staying here again when we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Orbit One Vacation Villas - Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sjansen571
Reviews.Content: Orbit One Vacation Villas is roomy, clean, and quiet. The units are a bit old and beginning to show thier age - broken tile and pealing paint in the bath. The appliances are new. The AC unit was loud, but cold. The resort amenities are limited, so don't plan to spend a lot of time here. It is at the entrance to Disney World, and you can be in the park in less than ten minutes. Is is close to the Interstate that gets you to Universal in 15 minutes. There is plenty of shopping nearby. It is a nice place to stay while you visit the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Came back for a second stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnWagner
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in mid july for a start of a business trip. I found the rooms to be very clean, and ready for my visit. Resort reception was prepared and very friendly when I checked in. They greeted us by name and had everything ready for us. The Vilas were more than I expected, very clean, and a very large space. Enough for two adults and two children. To say the least, when I found myself returning to Florida in October, I booked my full stay at the Villas's.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With This Resort”
Reviews.Author: Maggie-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online for a family vacation. I wanted a clean, spacious 2 bedroom villa with kitchen and sleeping for 5. I didn't want a big resort just pools with good swimming for my 2 grandsons ages 5 and 7.. I also wanted it close to Disney World since we planned to go 4 or 5 days. Well I got exactly what I wanted. The accommodations were fantastic. We even enjoyed a day at Liki Tiki water park compliments of the front desk staff. We also went to a Luau at Liki Tiki which was kind of cheesy but Dan Fogartey was there(AKA. Grizzly Adams) . My 7 year old gandson recognized him from some movie recently. It rained heavily 2 evenings when we were too tired to go out and the boys had space to play and let the tired adults rest. We even had a quick swim in the large tub when thunder and lightning interrupted our swim. Best of all my husband really was pleased with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Psykoticdoll
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. We stayed in Neptune and the rooms were gorgeous. We had an amazing week long vacation thanks to this place. After coming home if we needed anything they were right there to help us. If I ever go back this is where I'm staying. It's so much better with then a regular hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Wow What A Great Place!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JT7585
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a terrific stay. We took my 70 year old mom and dad and my 13 year old and her friend. This place is great. The pool is awsome and the entire place is really super nice! I would stay again in heartbeat and will keep this resort on the top of my list for orlando/kissimmee resorts

Reviews.Title: “We shall return!”
Reviews.Author: Nanarie
Reviews.Content: Almost perfect timing on our part combined with a really nice place to stay made our week vacation very enjoyable. The week before Memorial Day, last week of the pre-season turned out to be darned close to perfect timing for us. It was peaceful and quiet. Check-in: We were early yet they had a first floor unit available so we checked in about 3 hours early. The unit was great - curtains in all rooms worked for both privacy and heat control - it was clean - there were supplies: extra tp in each bathroom, bars of soap, a box of laundry deterg, packet of dishwasher deterg, a brillo pad, roll of paper towels, and a tiny bottle of dishwashing soap. The kitchen was fully stocked, and everything worked. There was a broom and dustpan in a closet as well as iron/ironing board, and a hairdryer. Midweek when we exchanged towels, we got another packet of dishwasher detergent and another box of laundry soap, as well as more tp. Nice touches we don't expect from a time-share. This is a small place, only about 10 buildings of approximately 24 units each, give or take. They are set in a small circle around a center area which includes a tennis court, bbq and picnic area, arcade building, pool, playground. The front of the place has a children's pool and a jacuzzi. The kids' pool is great for young kids with a slide and was quite active in the early evenings. And that left the other pool for the adults. It was peaceful. Our unit had a tv in the living room and each of the 2 bedrooms, a stereo in the 2nd bedroom, whirlpool tub in the master, and a dvd player in the living room. There is no smoking in the unit except on the porch. The dining area was plenty large and comfortable. Beds were comfortable and we slept well. However, the living room sofas are a bit hard but in good shape and clean. My only complaint about our week is that this place DOES have WiFi but we didn't learn about it until our last night - and only by accident. My stepson (20 yo) was on the porch connecting his cellphone to his laptop and he stumbled into a wifi network - it turned out to be Orbit One's and the charge was minimal!! Had we known, we would have brought our own laptop! Orbit One, YOU NEED TO TELL PEOPLE ABOUT THIS! It is not listed on their website, the list of amenities when you check in does not have a word about this. When I mentioned it on check-out, she said, "But it's a $xx per week charge!" It's far less than paying $10 per half hour at an internet cafe!!!!! We vacation in this area of Florida about once every 18-24 months. We love the area from WDW to Universal - Rte 192 and I-drive are great for all kinds of things. Because we are govt employees, we get fantastic rates by booking last minute and take whatever's available (2ndary market). If it's available next time, we will definitely go back to Orbit One.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to Disney Attractions!”
Reviews.Author: tab1115
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute as an exchange with our timeshare. We were looking for something very close to the Disney resorts and enough space and ammenities to keep my 3 children comfortable and happy. The unit wasn't bad at all - could have been a little cleaner and they could have supplied more paper products and cleaning products as other resorts do. But other than that, my kids loved the water slide pool which they used quite a few times and the basketball courts which my older son used. The nearby strip was a little seedy with all of the tacky strip malls (and a 120 minute wait for dinner at the Outback), but we certainly felt safe at the resort since there was constantly security guards patrolling the area. Check in and check out was anything but speedy!! The front desk people need a lesson on how to check someone in and out efficiently. The washer in our unit worked great but the dryer took about 3 plus hours to dry a small load. Because of the location (1 mile to Disney), I would definately recommend this resort to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: nunz100
Reviews.Content: What a very nice place to stay at. The rooms are immaculate and large. The surrounding grounds are very nice and close to stores and restaurants. Very happy with our stay. Our flight was cancelled and they were very accommodating to us. Very happy we stayed there. Their staff should be commended for all of their help and patience. I would recommend this resort for future travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Orbit One Villas”
Reviews.Author: bts10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at Orbit One Villas. I was a bit concerned due to some of the negative reviews. Our stay went well. The villa had plenty of room for our family (2 adults, 2 12 year olds). It was clean and quiet. We had an end unit in Apollo. Check in - We checked in late with security guard, it went smoothly. Grounds - Both pools were open and our kids enjoyed them. The grounds included a basketball court which our children enjoyed. Location - I would not classify this place as a resort but rather a great alternative place to stay near Disney, Sea World, Universal etc. The units have plenty of room, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths so we all had plenty of space. We were not looking to be entertained by the staff. The staff was helpful when we asked questions. I would stay here again to visit this area.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and still lovin this place”
Reviews.Author: suzann50
Reviews.Content: we booked this place as we have been here once before and loved it we never got a chance to try out there activitys so this time we made room even though they were simple mini golf ,tennis, basketball, gym and games room my children loved it and so did i i felt safe here and everyone was so friendly i love this place and so do my family i would reccomend this hotel to people who like simplicity and safeness

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jurnee
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in January 2008 because I got a very good deal on Skyauction. Even though I was a single traveler, I had two bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, a very good kitchen and more than enough space. The rooms were spotless and the king size bed in the master bedroom was extremely comfortable. It was wonderful having the Roman whirlpool bath - though some evenings I used the smaller bathtub because it didn't take as much water to fill. I had 2 TV sets and a DVD and loved the entire apartment. It's too bad I was hardly there but there are simply too many things to do in Orlando. I barely used the kitchen for making meals because it's too much trouble to stock it with the basics, like salt, pepper, ketchup etc. but if one wants to cook there are lots of utensils. The main pool was under repair, which was a little disappointing. There was apparently a smaller pool in the back but I didn't bother with it. In any case, the pool doesn't look great and isn't very big. The one downside was dragging heavy suitcases up and down three flights of stairs and the electronic key not working in the evening when nobody is staffing the front desk. A few days into my stay I found out they'd serve things for breakfast in the lobby but I never got it together to go there in time. They seem to have activities every day, but I didn't participate in any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: NCDawnM
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was maybe expecting a little too much. Our last few stays in Orlando have been at a different RCI resort, but that resort no longer uses SkyAuction, so I have been looking for another condo to use for our Orlando stay. CHECK IN Check in went very smoothly and the staff was very friendly. We were given a very nice 2 bedroom on the 3rd floor of Venus. The 3rd floor had vaulted ceilings and lots of light and was very spacious, clean and bright. NOISE LEVEL One difference between this place and some of the newer places I noticed immediately was the NOISE. We could hear our neighbors on both sides and I am sure they could hear us. The people on both sides were very nice families and were not loud party animals or anything, so I really do think the noise was just normal movement around the condo. I am a very light sleeper so noise levels are very important to me. AMMENITIES There was a washer and dryer in the closet and I am very glad. We have three young boys, so having a laundry was handy. The dryer was mounted to the wall and the washer was below. The lid to the washer didn't open much because of the location of the dryer, so we had to feel the clothing in the washer and pull it out piece by piece. It was just a minor inconvenience, but worth mentioning as it was difficult to reach in for smaller items. It was also very noisy and the washer "walked" around in the closet. The biggest noise for us was the heater. It got cold that week and we turned the heater on. It sounded like a huge can of something was in the vent rolling around. Finally we removed the filter and that seemed to help. INTERNET Another HUGE issue for us was internet use. You can buy internet use for $6 per day. I guess that isn't a bad price overall, but we didn't opt to use it. BOTTOM LINE Overall, the stay was pleasant. The visitors who stay at Orbit One are typically families or retirees and very nice and friendly people. I would stay here again, but would ask for an upper and end unit because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, great price”
Reviews.Author: smatamor
Reviews.Content: This is an old place, that provides clean, comfortable time share 2 bedroom apartments. I paid $200 for 7 nights (through Skyauction and even got a $100 gift certificate for a very nice local restaurant), which is a great deal, so for that price, the place is amazing... on the other hand, if I had to pay..I would say I wouldn't pay more than $50/night. Great location, 5 minutes from all Disney parks. No timeshare pressure, or required gatherings. I have been in better places, but it was not bad at all...just a little dated. I would definetely return for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Orbit One is nice place”
Reviews.Author: DrivingMan
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Orbit One in Kissimmee , FL over the Labor Day weekend...Our room was large, 2 bedroom/2 bath, and clean. 3 TVs...Having a full kitchen and dinning area was nice and very usefull. One thing that struck me as odd was that there were very few people staying here.. The place was deserted, literally, no one was there ( and yet they put us on the 3rd floor ). There are no elevators here... We stayed here for budget reasons....The Liki Tiki was more money....However, for $5.95 a day you can go to the Liki Tiki ( both Liki Tiki and Orbit One are Island One properties ). Orbit One is less expensive than the Liki Tiki, so we stayed at Orbit to safe $$s and took a day pass to the Liki Tiki.. ( Although, if I had to do it again, I would have booked the Liki Tiki and paid the $50 more per night ). Pros: Location is great - close to lots of dining and shopping. Rooms were clean.. and area is quiet. Rooms were large - great for kids. Day pass to Liki Tiki "water park": for $5.95/day.. Has a washer and dryer in room. Cons: Small resort - not much to do within the resort area.. Pool could have been cleaner. Older resort, buidlings look like they are in need of :"refreshing" the outsides, however the inside rooms were clean. Overall, I give the Orbit One a 4 out of 5. It was nice stay for us. Clean rooms , quiet and great location.... However, I don't understand why there were so few other vacationers there..

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay and great location.”
Reviews.Author: matthew777
Reviews.Content: First of all we are from the UK, family of 4 with a 8yr old and a 11yr old, so travel both west to the States and Caribbean and thorough ought Europe so have done quality and ruff and ready. So hopefully you will get a balanced view as being a Yorkshire man we say it how it is. So orbit one over all was a good place to stop. The rooms were good, not perfect but for that you need five star accommodation. The rooms were the most important thing, CLEAN ok there was the odd bit of trim missing but we are only talking the odd chip and the utensils and the kitchen was spotless. Now the bathrooms weren’t quite 10/10 with the Jacuzzi tired and noisy with a habit of turning the water brown. Now this to be honest wasn’t a problem as I didn’t fly all the way there just for a Jacuzzi . But overall the rooms were large and airy. Ok there wasn’t a lift and it was a pain getting to the top floor without a lift but many places don’t and im happy to work with a few steps at the beginning and end of the day. The pool was fine but the furniture round it has seen better days. With luck they have changed this by now. Staff well pretty average. No probs, no heavy time share push but they weren’t exactly running round after you. Location its good for Disney I have to say. The best recommendation is “would you go back again” well it has to be a big YES on this one. So in short it was fine, we liked our stay there and its good value for money which is all important. Nothing worse than coming back and feeling you got a poor return for your money

HotelInfo.Name: Orbit One Vacation Villas
HotelInfo.Address: 2950 Entry Point Boulvard, Kissimmee, FL 34741
